revised_title: Investigation of Water Damage in Polyester Resins: A Study of Cracking Mechanisms
tldr: This study investigates the nature and causes of cracks in polyester resins during water exposure. The researchers found that internal cracks are caused by high pressure generated from water interacting with impurities, particularly water-soluble inorganic inclusions. Surface cracking is similar to the crazing of ceramic glazes. The osmotic pressure from water-soluble inclusions and the interactions between water and cured polyester resins can create complex stress systems that lead to crack formation.
